body: First step to fix #124 Part of commits will be squashed, when code review finished --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/385)

comment_regular_data.body:
Reviewed 8 of 15 files at r1.
Review status: 8 of 15 files reviewed at latest revision, 3 unresolved discussions, some commit checks failed.

---

*[toxcore/TCP_client.c, line 38 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/385#-K_iffgX-9nWdVWlRqK7:-K_iffgYfGvO26FtRogE:b-7bccfp) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/108cc04eb5839f64c92440e3eb02e1915296e4fa/toxcore/TCP_client.c#L38)):*
> ```C
>  * return 0 on failure
>  */
> static int connect_tox_socko(tox_sock sock, IP_Port ip_port, TCP_Proxy_Info *proxy_info)
> ```

Should have used word-boundary match. There was a `sock_t` in this.

---

*[toxcore/TCP_client.h, line 55 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/385#-K_ifoV7HTgba3Am4uLF:-K_ifoV7HTgba3Am4uLG:bem089t) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/108cc04eb5839f64c92440e3eb02e1915296e4fa/toxcore/TCP_client.h#L55)):*
> ```objc
> typedef struct  {
>     uint8_t status;
>     tox_sock  sock;
> ```

Fix alignment (by removing it).

---

*[toxcore/TCP_server.h, line 92 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/385#-K_ifzvQXYLHXMn_8Qd4:-K_ifzvQXYLHXMn_8Qd5:b-3kbfsh) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/108cc04eb5839f64c92440e3eb02e1915296e4fa/toxcore/TCP_server.h#L92)):*
> ```objc
> 
> typedef struct TCP_Secure_Connection {
>     tox_sock  sock;
> ```

Remove extra space between type and identifier.

*[toxcore/network.c, line 328 at r2](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/385#-K_n-wvfJPYQE_8BRdlG:-K_n-wvfJPYQE_8BRdlH:b-wnb9wz) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/4a8fc9f2dd9433c35a0e874cdca41d85185e0219/toxcore/network.c#L328)):*
> ```C
> IP4 get_ip4(const struct in_addr *addr)
> {
>     IP4 result;
> ```

My apologies to iphy, is this really the most efficient way to do this? Or does it grant us any safety?

---

*[toxcore/network.h, line 61 at r2](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/385#-K_myyA7ecCpzto8wIlA:-K_myyA8ENlgZRlfvuQd:b98vlfs) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/4a8fc9f2dd9433c35a0e874cdca41d85185e0219/toxcore/network.h#L61)):*
> ```objc
> 
> typedef unsigned short int sa_family_t;
> typedef int tox_sock;
> ```

thoughts on making this `SOCK_TOX`? I'd rather it be a little more obvious we're wrapping/creating a platform abstraction (This is the way uTox does it)

My apologies to iphy, is this really the most efficient way to do this? Or does it grant us any safety?
I'm not sure, but I think in the future "Network cleanup" I will replace `in_addr` on platform-independent `in_addr_tox` and remove this function --- *[toxcore/network.h, line 61 at r2](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/385#-K_myyA7ecCpzto8wIlA:-K_nNc_PC3rw77DS_tuh:b1rrgev) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/4a8fc9f2dd9433c35a0e874cdca41d85185e0219/toxcore/network.h#L61)):*

Review status: 7 of 15 files reviewed at latest revision, 4 unresolved discussions, some commit checks failed. --- *[toxcore/network.c, line 328 at r2](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/385#-K_n-wvfJPYQE_8BRdlG:-K_pNLzBx6R7LtAY8kiW:bkxrltz) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/4a8fc9f2dd9433c35a0e874cdca41d85185e0219/toxcore/network.c#L328)):*
Previously, Diadlo (Polshakov Dmitry) wrote…
I'm not sure, but I think in the future "Network cleanup" I will replace `in_addr` on platform-independent `in_addr_tox` and remove this function
Then my suggestion is to make IP_Port the abstraction level, and then make network.c handle that level. I.e., everything above the network layer can pass an IP_Port struct, and never needs to know anything about it, because it'll all be handled right before sending, or right after receiving. --- *Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/385)*

Review status: 4 of 15 files reviewed at latest revision, 4 unresolved discussions. --- *[toxcore/network.c, line 328 at r2](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/385#-K_n-wvfJPYQE_8BRdlG:-K_sibTc4EQI_yXngRgX:bt2yosk) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/4a8fc9f2dd9433c35a0e874cdca41d85185e0219/toxcore/network.c#L328)):*
Previously, GrayHatter (Gregory Mullen) wrote…
Then my suggestion is to make IP_Port the abstraction level, and then make network.c handle that level. I.e., everything above the network layer can pass an IP_Port struct, and never needs to know anything about it, because it'll all be handled right before sending, or right after receiving.
I have improved `get_ip4` --- *Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/385)*

*[toxcore/network.h, line 139 at r3](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/385#-Ka-dZGP3mMs3ca23h1Y:-Ka-dZGP3mMs3ca23h1Z:bkxj2p0) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/d69006b0e27ea2b145ff205e5bbe169a0b64f1ff/toxcore/network.h#L139)):*
> ```objc
> IP_Port;
> 
> void get_ip4(IP4 *ip, const struct in_addr *addr);
> ```

Add a comment about what all of these promise, or the limits callers must check, and everything will LGTM

---


*Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/385)*
<!-- Sent from Reviewable.io -->

*[toxcore/network.c, line 329 at r3](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/385#-Ka-g1UsLdM49tOrYRZV:-Ka-g1UsLdM49tOrYRZW:b-orheg9) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/d69006b0e27ea2b145ff205e5bbe169a0b64f1ff/toxcore/network.c#L329)):*
> ```C
> void get_ip4(IP4 *result, const struct in_addr *addr)
> {
>     memcpy(result, addr, sizeof(IP4));
> ```

For this to work properly, `sizeof(struct in_addr) >= sizeof(IP4)` should be true, otherwise we will run over `addr`. What gives us this guarantee? Maybe add an assert?

---

Review status: 12 of 15 files reviewed at latest revision, 5 unresolved discussions, some commit checks failed. --- *[toxcore/network.c, line 335 at r9](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/385#-Ka4uoUn9xKIdeBE3NIM:-Ka4uoUn9xKIdeBE3NIN:b9el54g) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/0dff10f380c06ffe9bcf40a5adcc7a339a1fd3b9/toxcore/network.c#L335)):* > ```C > void get_ip6(IP6 *result, const struct in6_addr *addr) > { > assert(sizeof(result->uint8) == sizeof(addr->s6_addr)); > ``` These asserts can be evaluated at build time and I would really want them to be evaluated at build time, even in non-debug mode. Can we add something like C++'s static assert to toxcore? (@iphydf have already done that with a negative size VLA). --- *[toxcore/network.h, line 44 at r3](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/385#-Ka-hmw-FB7waWeti4IQ:-Ka4w02on3Twre2EgceG:b-3zvq4h) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/9d56db3a54d54740eca82a92b04fc3a7828f3eee/toxcore/network.h#L44)):*
Previously, Diadlo (Polshakov Dmitry) wrote…
Returned
It is used to enable things in Windows headers, similar to the posix version defines, gnu source defines and so on. --- *Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/385)*

Reviewed 1 of 3 files at r9. Review status: 13 of 15 files reviewed at latest revision, 4 unresolved discussions, some commit checks failed. --- *[toxcore/network.c, line 335 at r9](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/385#-Ka4uoUn9xKIdeBE3NIM:-Ka57ScHPeYOrQbtSEM9:bhwg735) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/0dff10f380c06ffe9bcf40a5adcc7a339a1fd3b9/toxcore/network.c#L335)):*
Previously, nurupo wrote…
These asserts can be evaluated at build time and I would really want them to be evaluated at build time, even in non-debug mode. Can we add something like C++'s static assert to toxcore? (@iphydf have already done that with a negative size VLA).
```c #if __cplusplus >= 201103L #define STATIC_ASSERT static_assert #elif defined(HAVE_C_STATIC_ASSERT) #define STATIC_ASSERT _Static_assert #else #define PP_CONCAT(x, y) PP_CONCAT_(x, y) #define PP_CONCAT_(x, y) x##y #define STATIC_ASSERT(cond, msg) typedef char PP_CONCAT(static_assert_, __LINE__)[(cond) ? 1 : -1] #endif ``` --- *Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/385)*

Review status: all files reviewed at latest revision, 3 unresolved discussions, some commit checks failed. --- *[toxcore/network.c, line 335 at r9](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/385#-Ka4uoUn9xKIdeBE3NIM:-KaaifK3AAZruFXPTFyX:b-7xaazx) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/5f30fe56cb91a852bc3aa205756e4f84533d86f0/toxcore/network.c#L335)):*
Previously, GrayHatter (Gregory Mullen) wrote…
yes, that is what I was thinking, but I'm okay with any method that'll work (I never verified my suggestion)
This suggestion doesn't work, because sizeof is a compile time thing, while `#if` is a preprocessor thing. The preprocessor doesn't have access to any lexical context or C language keywords; it's just a text replace mechanism with some simple computations with integer literals. --- *Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/385)*
